posts.post_content:
I love how Aluren's price jumps to $15 every three years because the Legacy Aluren combo deck is winning tournaments again. People forget about it long enough, they don't playtest against it, WHAM they die to infinitecreatureflashbang.  
  
There are only **two** combo decks that have survived in Legacy (with no bannings) and have placed tournament top results for longer than five years: the deck built on this card, and the [High Tide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=High Tide) deck that uses [Reset](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reset) and draw spells. (Three combo decks if you count all Tendrils decks the same, but Tendrils tends to come back strong only whenever there's a new bomb draw card, like when they printed [Ad Nauseam](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ad Nauseam).) Aluren doesn't get banned because it doesn't dominate, because the combo deck is *very* hard to learn to play well -- 9 times out of 10, after a match you're thinking "oh god I could've won if only I had thought to do..." even if you're a seasoned expert.  
  
You are currently lo... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I love how Aluren's price jumps to $15 every three years because the Legacy Aluren combo deck is winning tournaments again. People forget about it long enough, they don't playtest against it, WHAM they die to infinitecreatureflashbang.

There are only two combo decks that have survived in Legacy (with no bannings) and have placed tournament top results for longer than five years: the deck built on this card, and the High Tide deck that uses Reset and draw spells. (Three combo decks if you count all Tendrils decks the same, but Tendrils tends to come back strong only whenever there's a new bomb draw card, like when they printed Ad Nauseam.) Aluren doesn't get banned because it doesn't dominate, because the combo deck is very hard to learn to play well -- 9 times out of 10, after a match you're thinking "oh god I could've won if only I had thought to do..." even if you're a seasoned expert.

I think the "any player" clause was meant to make it "fair". In the sense that dropping a twenty-ton weight on your opponent would also be fair. Goes very nicely with [Animar, Soul of Elements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animar, Soul of Elements) as your commander.  
  
On an unrelated note, what's the flavor of this card? Is this an enchanted rainforest where animals jump out unexpectedly at you?

posts.post_content: Sweet, sweet Aluren. How I used to enjoy dropping you on turn four after a [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise)'d out turn-three [Pandemonium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pandemonium) and going "[Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning), [Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning), swing, in response to combat damage, [Phyrexian Dreadnought](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Dreadnought)" because frankly, there are very few situations in which doing 36 damage on turn four is not hilarious. Then that [Cavern Harpy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cavern Harpy) came along and you went all mainstream. But after the memories we've shared, Aluren, I could never stay mad at you.
posts.html:

Posted By: zenitramleirdag (7/11/2012 5:43:53 AM)

posts.post_content:
So, stupid combo deck question:  
  
Are there enough self-replacing cards assuming Aluren is in play to build the world's silliest [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac) deck? Candidates so far:  
  
- [Elvish Visionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Visionary)  
- [Alchemist's Apprentice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Alchemist's Apprentice)  
- [Wall of Omens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Omens)  
- [Wall of Blossoms](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Blossoms)  
- [Sarcomite Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarcomite Myr)  
- [Street Wraith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Street Wraith)  
- [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe)  
- [Manamorphose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Manamorphose)  
- Anything with a low cycling cost (Sarcomite Myr probably qualifies for this more than anything)  
  
You'd need [Mana Severance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Severance), I imagine, but the basic idea is to run a whole lot of "empty" card slots and therefore use the Maniac to win. Alternatively, having a bunch of empty slots and a combo in the deck somewhere could work.
posts.html:
So, stupid combo deck question:

Are there enough self-replacing cards assuming Aluren is in play to build the world's silliest Laboratory Maniac deck? Candidates so far:

- Elvish Visionary
- Alchemist's Apprentice
- Wall of Omens
- Wall of Blossoms
- Sarcomite Myr
- Street Wraith
- Gitaxian Probe
- Manamorphose
- Anything with a low cycling cost (Sarcomite Myr probably qualifies for this more than anything)

You'd need Mana Severance, I imagine, but the basic idea is to run a whole lot of "empty" card slots and therefore use the Maniac to win. Alternatively, having a bunch of empty slots and a combo in the deck somewhere could work.
